bibl.editor: Surgeon General Joseph K. Barnes, United States Army

initial checking of OCR text against PDF; encoded

body.p: CASE.—Private Joseph Warwick, Co. A, 26th Michigan Volunteers, was wounded at the battle of Mine Run, Virginia, November 27th, 1863, by a conoidal ball which struck in the centre of the forehead and apparently penetrated the bone. He was sent to the hospital of the 1st division, Second Corps, thence was conveyed to Alexandria, and on December 4th was admitted to the 1st division hospital in a state of insensibility. Consciousness never returned, and death ensued December 6th, 1863.
